member.name: T:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryReader
member.summary: Extends the class to allow reading of integers and doubles in the Big Endian format.
member.remarks: The BinaryReader uses Little Endian format when reading binary streams.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BigEndianBinaryReader class based on the supplied stream and using UTF8Encoding.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BigEndianBinaryReader class based on the supplied stream and a specific character encoding.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryReader.ReadInt32BE
member.summary: Reads a 4-byte signed integer using the big-endian layout from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by four bytes.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryReader.ReadDoubleBE
member.summary: Reads a 8-byte signed double using the big-endian layout from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by eight bytes.

member.name: T:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter
member.summary: Extends the class to allow the writing of integers and double values in the Big Endian format.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BigEndianBinaryWriter class.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BigEndianBinaryWriter class based on the supplied stream and using UTF-8 as the encoding for strings.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BigEndianBinaryWriter class based on the supplied stream and a specific character encoding.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter.WriteIntBE(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a 4-byte signed integer using the big-endian layout from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by two bytes.
member.param: The four-byte signed integer to write.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.BigEndianBinaryWriter.WriteDoubleBE(System.Double)
member.summary: Reads a 8-byte signed integer using the big-endian layout from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by two bytes.
member.param: The four-byte signed integer to write.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DbaseFileHeader class.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.DbaseFileHeader.AddColumn(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a column to this DbaseFileHeader.
member.param: The name of the field to add.
The type is one of (C N L or D) character, number, logical(true/false), or date.
The Field length is the total length in bytes reserved for this column.
The decimal count only applies to numbers(N), and floating point values (F), and refers to the number of characters to reserve after the decimal point.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.DbaseFileHeader.RemoveColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a column from this DbaseFileHeader.
member.returns: return index of the removed column, -1 if no found.

member.summary: Let the code run into exception

member.summary: Create an empty geometry instead

member.name: F:NetTopologySuite.IO.Handlers.GeometryInstantiationErrorHandlingOption.TryFix
member.summary: Try to fix the geometry
member.remarks:
Possible fixes are:
For LineStrings with only one point provided, duplicate that point to have at least two points.
For LinearRings with unclosed coordinate sequence, close the sequence by adding a clone of the first coordinate
...
For Holes in polygon, use

member.summary: Ignore this geometry/feature altogether

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given .

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapefileWriter.Write(GeoAPI.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Adds a shape to the shapefile. You must have used the constrcutor with a filename to use this method!

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapefileWriter.Write(System.String,GeoAPI.Geometries.IGeometryCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to write a collection of s to a file named
member.remarks: Assumes the type given for the first geometry is the same for all subsequent geometries. For example, is, if the first Geometry is a Multi-polygon/ Polygon, the subsequent geometies are Muli-polygon/ polygon and not lines or points. The dbase file for the corresponding shapefile contains one column called row. It contains the row number.
member.param: Set to true to create a dummy dbf along with the shp file

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapefileWriter.WriteGeometryCollection(System.String,GeoAPI.Geometries.IGeometryCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to write a collection of geometries to a shapefile on disk.
member.remarks: Assumes the type given for the first geometry is the same for all subsequent geometries. For example, is, if the first Geometry is a Multi-polygon/ Polygon, the subsequent geometies are Muli-polygon/ polygon and not lines or points. The dbase file for the corresponding shapefile contains one column called row. It contains the row number.
member.param: The filename to write to (minus the .shp extension).
Set to true to create an empty DBF-file along with the shp-file

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapefileWriter.WriteDummyDbf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to write a dummy dbf file

member.summary: Method to write a dummy dbase file

member.summary: Method to write a dummy dbase file

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapefileWriter.WriteFeatures(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{NetTopologySuite.Features.IFeature},NetTopologySuite.IO.DbaseFieldDescriptor[],NetTopologySuite.IO.ShapeGeometryType,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Write the enumeration of features to shapefile (shp, shx and dbf)
member.param: Enumeration of features to write, features will be enumerated once
Fields that should be written, only those attributes specified here will be mapped from the feature attributetable while writing
Optional Encoding to be used when writing the DBF-file (default Windows-1252)
